definitions.definition: used to make a request more polite:
examples: Could I have two coffees and a tea, please?

definitions.definition: used to add force to a request or demand:
examples: Please, David, put the knife down.

definitions.definition: used especially by children to a teacher or other adult in order to get their attention:
examples: Please, Miss, I know the answer!

definitions.definition: used when accepting something politely or enthusiastically:
to make someone feel happy or satisfied, or to give someone pleasure:
examples: I only got married to please my parents.

definitions.definition: to want, like, or choose, when used with words such as "whatever", "whoever", and "anywhere":
examples: She thinks she can just do whatever/as she pleases.

definitions.definition: used to express surprise and anger:
examples: They want £200, if you please, just to replace a couple of broken windows!

definitions.definition: used to make a request more polite:
examples: Take your seats, ladies and gentlemen, if you please.
